title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.6 | 28-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Because of the kings having no enemy the living beings were not at any time disturbed by mental agonies, diseases or excessive heat or cold.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces verse 6 from the 10th chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, explaining how the absence of enemies under a righteous king leads to a peaceful existence free from various miseries.

segments.key_quote: Our existence in this material world is always disturbed by three kinds of miseries imposed by material nature upon all of us.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the three types of miseries (Daiva, Bhuta, and Atma) that cause suffering in the material world, explaining their origins and effects on living beings.

segments.key_quote: To be non-violent to human beings and to be a killer or enemy of the poor animals is Saturn's philosophy.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the peaceful conditions under Yudhishthira Maharaj's rule with the current state of affairs, criticizing the hypocrisy of being kind to humans while harming animals.

segments.key_quote: Why should people kill poor animals?
segments.summary: The speaker condemns the unnecessary killing of animals for food, advocating for vegetarianism and emphasizing the right of all creatures to live under the protection of a ruler.

segments.key_quote: There is enmity towards poor animals and therefore the poor creatures are always anxious.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the anxiety and suffering of animals due to human cruelty, criticizing godless governments that fail to protect them.

segments.key_quote: The war or this fighting between human beings is a reaction by mother nature because these people indulge in killing animals.
segments.summary: The speaker connects the widespread killing of animals to the occurrence of wars and conflicts, suggesting that these are reactions from nature.

segments.key_quote: If the government or the head of state is conversant with these religious principles and rules according to the scriptural codes, then all the people will be peaceful happy and there will be plenty of supply.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by highlighting the benefits of a God-conscious ruler who follows scriptural principles, leading to peace, happiness, and abundance for all.
